locations.name: CN Tower
locations.address: 301 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6
locations.description: One of the world’s tallest freestanding structures, the CN Tower offers stunning panoramic views of Toronto. Visitors can enjoy the glass floor, the EdgeWalk, and fine dining at the 360 Restaurant.

locations.name: Royal Ontario Museum (ROM)
locations.description: Canada’s largest museum of world cultures and natural history, featuring dinosaur fossils, Egyptian artifacts, and Indigenous art. The ROM’s iconic crystal-shaped entrance is a Toronto landmark.

locations.name: Ontario Science Centre
locations.address: 770 Don Mills Rd, Toronto, ON M3C 1T3
locations.description: An interactive museum that brings science to life with hands-on exhibits, a planetarium, and immersive experiences for all ages. It’s a great destination for learning and discovery.

locations.name: Casa Loma
locations.description: A majestic Gothic-style castle with secret tunnels, grand halls, and lush gardens. Once a private residence, it’s now a popular tourist attraction and event venue.

locations.name: Toronto Zoo
locations.description: One of the largest zoos in the world, featuring diverse habitats, over 5,000 animals, and conservation programs. Highlights include the giant pandas (when visiting), polar bears, and African savanna exhibits.

locations.name: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
locations.description: A spectacular underwater attraction featuring thousands of marine animals, a moving walkway through a shark tunnel, and interactive touch pools. A top spot for families and ocean lovers.

locations.name: Canada's Wonderland
locations.address: 1 Canada's Wonderland Dr, Vaughan, ON L6A 1S6
locations.description: A thrilling amusement park featuring over 200 attractions, including roller coasters, a massive water park, and family-friendly rides. Known for Leviathan and Yukon Striker, it’s a must-visit for adrenaline seekers.

locations.name: Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO)
locations.address: 317 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5T 1G4
locations.description: Home to a vast collection of over 95,000 artworks, including pieces by the Group of Seven, European masters, and contemporary artists. The AGO also features stunning architecture by Frank Gehry.
